p: It is not easy, at present, to identify the reason for the detected selective drop in the 27OHC serum level during SARS-CoV-2 infection in the course of COVID-19. The most plausible hypothesis is that a progressive “mitochondrial stress” would occur at systemic level in those pathological conditions, and that such an impairment would affect the activity of the ubiquitous mitochondrial 27-cholesterol hydroxylase (Cyp27A1) [ 51], which is the enzyme that converts cholesterol to 27OHC.
